WorkItem.Description:
The following items are labelled as normal Ulduar but are from 25 man, not 10 man:
Â 
45266, 45459, 45461, 45517, 45663
WorkItem.Summary: [Items] Incorrect sources for a few items

Comments.Message:
Uh, no....

Example: Malice - compare it to another one-hand sword, Runescribed Blade, which is correctly flagged.

Malice and Runescribed Blade from armory both show Ulduar and heroic="1"

The source info for the two items from wowhead also has the same zone/etc, so the data appears to be fine on the sites.

So if they have same data and one is mis-flagged, how is this a problem in the data?
Also, I deleted Malice entirely and re-added it from Armory, which has the correct info, and it again flags it as Ulduar 10, so the problem appears to be in Rawr.

It's bad data from wowhead/armory, there's nothing we can do about it. Try refreshing each item from the other location. If that fails, report it to Wowhead.



** Closed by Jothay 10/31/2009 7:18 PM
Wowhead and Armory both have had a bug for a while that they didn't return normal/heroic for items in chests, in their xml data. Anyone see if they've fixed that then?

Snippet from Malice's XML on Armory:

<object area="Ulduar"
        areaUrl="fl[source]=dungeon&fl[dungeon]=ulduar&fl[boss]=all&fl[difficulty]=all"
        dropRate="3"
        heroic="1"
        id="195047"
        name="Cache of Living Stone"/>

So apparently they fixed it, as the XML for Stoneguard, another item from kologarn's chest but in 10 man, does not have heroic="1" - Rawr just doesn't seem to use it.
